key_points: Philadelphia Eagles defensive tackle Fletcher Cox is attracting interest before the NFL trade deadline.
NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reported teams are inquiring about Cox, with the Eagles open to a trade for a quality draft pick.
Cox has been with the Eagles for his entire 10-year career and is a six-time Pro-Bowl selection.
Potential trade destinations include the Baltimore Ravens, Tennessee Titans, and Arizona Cardinals.
Cox's abilities could significantly impact the Ravens' defense, enhancing their interior pass rush.
The Titans could use Cox to bolster their interior pass rush, especially after losing Derrick Henry indefinitely.
Cox could replace J.J. Watt for the Arizona Cardinals, aiding in their interior defensive line.
The trade could involve Cox moving for a combination of draft picks, including a 2022 fourth-round pick and a 2023 second-round pick to the Eagles.
Cox's addition to any team would enhance their defensive capabilities, providing an experienced interior pass rusher.
Teams are seeking to strengthen their rosters mid-season, similarly to how the Los Angeles Rams acquired Von Miller.
